reviewText: MADE A FEW MEMORIES FOR ME WATCHING. THIS SEASON WAS WHEN  HENRY WINKLER WAS STILL CREATING HIS CHARACHTER ARTHUR FONZARELLI ALIAS "THE FONZ" SO IT STILL LACKED THE BETTER QUALITY EPISODES THAT WERE STILL TO COME.  MAY OR MAY NOT GET FURTHER SEASONS OF THE SHOW.

Bought this as a Christmas present for a relative; however, I remember the series for TV.  Now that says something in it self that I remember and not only that but the individual characters.  If you enjoy older TV, this would be a series to add to your collection.
I have never had a bad experience with any of the sellers that I have dealt with including this one. My product has gotten to me in record time. My thanks to all of you!
This was a mixed bag.  I don't think that I would have rated any of the episodes as one of my favorites.  I watched a a few episodes mostly to hear the old songs.

what's going on why can't us people get the remaining seasons 5 thru 11 it's not fair not able to get them come on guy's from amazon if you are willing to bring memories to us people with seasons 1 thru 4 why not the rest of the seasons I know you can do it can't hardly wait to get them

My daughter LOVES Happy Days. I got this set for her for her birthday, and now she giggles and blushes every time the Fonz appears. PLUS.... Did you know they talk about and actually say the word SEX in the pilot! OMG I laughed so hard. Almost as hard as Fonzies hair. Just wait until you see Mr. C. in a hot steamy bathroom discussing sex with his son.
If one could only go back in time,whata time this was.  Good selection of episodes. The Fonz without his leather?  yes

my favorite episode is on season 5. robin williams as mork i think was the funniest thing he was in. mork and mindy was not a funny show but mork on happy days was hilarious.im waiting for season 5 so i can get that episode.
If you have the first 4 available seasons you don't need this. I am patiently waiting for the remaining seasons. Wish they would get off their butts and release the remainings seasons.

We bought seasons 1-4 for Christmas and just finished the last episode of Season 4.  Its been fun introducing our 15 year old daughter to a show my wife and I grew up with and loved. Now we have her hooked on it too.  The DVD's are well made and presented nicely.  I have just one question..Where are the rest of the seasons??  Please release season 5 - 11 !!!
love this show

I wait for

I've been a fan of this show for numerous years, sadly it went off the air when I was 3 years old in 1984. With Richie (Ron Howard) & The Fonz (Henry Winkler) shared a close friendship from 1976 to when Richie & Lori Beth moved to Los Angeles when Richie became a movie director in 1980, Richie considered The Fonz as a brother to him since The Fonz helped Richie out when Richie was in the Army & couldn't be there when Little Richie was born, so The Fonz was there to coach & support Lori Beth before Little Richie was born & Richie was so thankful that The Fonz was there @ the right time. With Richie & The Fonz & Ralph Malph (Don Most) & Potsie Weber (Anson Williams) were good friends during Richie's high school years & all through college & army training & remained friends when Richie married Lori Beth. So, if you or anyone you know is a die hard Happy Days fan, get this DVD, it talks about family life & friendships that will last forever.
Great
Great Memories
Excellent addition to any Happy Days fan's DVD collection.
